Description: Entrance to the First Temple of Karnak; a square court, partly ruined, surrounded by double columns of the closed lotus form, covered with paintings and hieroglyphics, near the foreground right an Arab seated on the sand heaped up round the bases of the pillars, one of which has half fallen, another court visible through doorway beyond Watercolour and bodycolour; on buff paper
Bibliographic references: Binyon 1898-1907 / Catalogue of drawings by British artists, and artists of foreign origin working in Great Britain (35)
Exhibition history: 1987 Feb 5 - May 25, BM, 'An A-Z of P&D' 1991 Sept-Nov, Bristol AG, 'Muller', no. 106
